title: Authors and Citation
text: Achtelik W, Kozubek M (2023). hmsr: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://wojtacht.github.io/hms/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {hmsr: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS},   author = {Wojciech Achtelik and Marcin Kozubek},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://wojtacht.github.io/hms/}, }

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: HMS mixture multi-deme evolutionary algorithm gradient-based optimization methods. multi-population evolutionary strategy, HMS makes use particular data structure provides organization among sub-populations (demes). tree fixed maximal height variable internal node degree. tree parent–child semantics. package provide implementation Simple Genetic Algorithm used demes. However default configuration uses SGA implementation GA package available CRAN.

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: can install released version hmsr CRAN: development version repository:

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: run HMS default configuration arguments provided bounds domain: lower upper
code: library(hmsr) f <- function(x)  (x^2+x)*cos(x) HMS <- hms(fitness = f, lower = -10, upper = 10) HMS@best_solution #> [1] 6.560544

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: number parameters used strategy configuration. sample runs HMS Eggholder function - benchmark optimization problems.  see structure demes tree end evaluation, use printTree function display plot showing best solution changed evaluation use plot(HMS)
code: library(smoof) Eggholder <- smoof::makeEggholderFunction() lower <- rep(-512, 2) upper <- rep(512, 2) sigma <- list(rep(200, 2), rep(100, 2), rep(50, 2)) ga_config <- list(     list(         pmutation = 0.4,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[1]])     ),     list(         pmutation = 0.2,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[2]])     ),     list(         pmutation = 0.2,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[3]])     ) ) HMS <- hms(     fitness = Eggholder,     minimize = TRUE,     tree_height = 3,     lower = lower,     upper = upper,     run_metaepoch = ga_metaepoch(ga_config),     population_sizes = c(50, 30, 15),     sigma = sigma,     gsc = gsc_max_fitness_evaluations(20000),     sc = sc_max_metric(euclidean_distance, c(40, 20, 10)),     lsc = lsc_metaepochs_without_improvement(15),     monitor_level = "none",     with_gradient_method = TRUE ) printTree(HMS) #> f(476.52, 431.37) = 943.07 evaluations: 7675 A #> ├-- spr: (507.90, 402.59); f(480.26, 430.74) = 956.02 evaluations: 1955 A #> |   └-- spr: (507.49, 400.58); f(482.35, 432.88) = 956.92 evaluations: 879 A #> ├-- spr: (479.43, 436.05); f(478.82, 429.39) = 954.55 evaluations: 2341 A #> |   └-- spr: (480.59, 430.58); f(482.35, 432.88) = 956.92 evaluations: 1075 A #> └-- spr: (365.96, 500.10); f(507.31, 401.35) = 938.19 evaluations: 4293 A #>     └-- spr: (441.83, 454.04); ***f(512.00, 404.23) = 959.64*** evaluations: 2000 A

title: A S4 class representing a snapshot of one metaepoch. — MetaepochSnapshot-class
text: demes list objects class Deme. best_fitness numeric - best fitness value metaepoch. best_solution numeric - best solution metaepoch. time_in_seconds numeric - time metaepoch seconds. fitness_evaluations numeric - number fitness evaluations. blocked_sprouts list - list sprouts blocked sprouting condition. sprout potential origin new Deme, can blocked sc -- sprouting condition. See sc_max_metric details. is_evolutionary logical - TRUE metaepochs except gradient one.

title: Function that runs one ecr metaepoch. Wrapper function for ecr::ecr. — ecr_metaepoch
code: tree_height <- 3 empty_config_ecr <- lapply(1:tree_height, function(x) {   list() }) ecr_metaepoch(empty_config_ecr) #> function (fitness, suggestions, lower, upper, tree_level, minimize)  #> { #>     config <- config_ecr[[tree_level]] #>     legal_passed_param_names <- Filter(function(name) { #>         name %in% methods::formalArgs(ecr::ecr) #>     }, names(config)) #>     population_size <- nrow(suggestions) #>     iterations_count <- 5 #>     params <- list(mu = population_size, mutator = ecr::setup(ecr::mutGauss,  #>         lower = lower, upper = upper), lambda = 1L) #>     for (param_name in legal_passed_param_names) { #>         params[param_name] <- config[param_name] #>     } #>     params$fitness.fun <- fitness #>     params$n.objectives <- 1L #>     params$minimize <- minimize #>     params$lower <- lower #>     params$upper <- upper #>     params$n.dim <- length(lower) #>     params$initial.solutions <- matrix_to_list(suggestions) #>     params$representation <- "float" #>     params$monitor <- FALSE #>     params$terminators <- list(ecr::stopOnIters(max.iter = iterations_count *  #>         population_size)) #>     result <- do.call(ecr::ecr, params) #>     population <- list_to_matrix(result$last.population, length(lower)) #>     list(solution = result$best.x[[1]], population = population,  #>         value = result$best.y[[1]]) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x56150f403dd8> #> <environment: 0x56150f401268>

title: Function that runs one GA metaepoch. Wrapper function for GA::ga. — ga_metaepoch
text: list named fields: solution, population, value. solution value decision variable giving best fitness. population matrix representing final population. Value value fitness function solution.

title: Function that runs one GA metaepoch. Wrapper function for GA::ga. — ga_metaepoch
code: tree_height <- 3 empty_config_ga <- lapply(1:tree_height, function(x) {   list() }) ga_metaepoch(empty_config_ga) #> function (fitness, suggestions, lower, upper, tree_level, minimize)  #> { #>     ga_fitness <- ifelse(minimize, function(x) { #>         -1 * fitness(x) #>     }, fitness) #>     config <- config_ga[[tree_level]] #>     legal_passed_param_names <- Filter(function(name) { #>         name %in% methods::formalArgs(GA::ga) #>     }, names(config)) #>     params <- list(maxiter = 5, popSize = nrow(suggestions)) #>     for (param_name in legal_passed_param_names) { #>         params[param_name] <- config[param_name] #>     } #>     params$fitness <- ga_fitness #>     params$lower <- lower #>     params$upper <- upper #>     params$suggestions <- suggestions #>     params$type <- "real-valued" #>     params$monitor <- FALSE #>     GA <- do.call(GA::ga, params) #>     value <- ifelse(minimize, GA@fitnessValue * -1, GA@fitnessValue) #>     list(solution = c(GA@solution[1, ]), population = GA@population,  #>         value = value) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x5615154feb10> #> <environment: 0x5615155026e8>

the computation. It results in hms running until there are no more
active demes. — gsc_trivial

title: A S4 class representing a result of hms. — hms-class
text: root_id character - UUID root Deme. metaepoch_snapshots list objects class MetaepochSnapshot. best_fitness numeric - best fitness value metaepochs. best_solution numeric -  best solution metaepochs. total_time_in_seconds numeric - time hms execution seconds. total_metaepoch_time_in_seconds numeric - time metaepochs seconds. metaepochs_count numeric - total number metaepochs. deme_population_sizes numeric - sizes deme populations tree level. population_sizes parameter hms function. lower numeric - lower bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. upper numeric - upper bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. call language - object class "call" representing matched call.

what: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
text: Maximization (minimization) fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy.

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
code: hms(   tree_height = 3,   minimize = FALSE,   fitness,   lower,   upper,   sigma = default_sigma(lower, upper, tree_height),   population_sizes = default_population_sizes(tree_height),   run_metaepoch = default_ga_metaepoch(tree_height),   gsc = gsc_default,   lsc = lsc_default,   sc = sc_max_metric(euclidean_distance, sprouting_default_euclidean_distances(sigma)),   create_population = default_create_population(sigma),   suggestions = NULL,   with_gradient_method = FALSE,   gradient_method_args = default_gradient_method_args,   run_gradient_method,   monitor_level = "basic",   parallel = FALSE )

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
text: tree_height numeric - default value: 5. determines maximum tree height usually reached unless strict local stopping condition, global stopping condition sprouting condition used. minimize logical - TRUE fitness shall minimized. fitness fitness function, returns numerical value, optimized strategy. lower numeric - lower bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. upper numeric - upper bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. sigma numeric - Vector standard deviations tree level used create population sprouted deme. population_sizes numeric - Sizes deme populations tree level. run_metaepoch function takes 5 parameters: fitness, suggestions, lower, upper, tree_level, runs metaepoch given deme population returns list 3 named fields: solution, population, value. gsc global stopping condition function taking list MetaepochSnapshot objects returning logical value; evaluated every metaepoch determines whether whole computation stopped. See gsc_metaepochs_count details. lsc local stopping condition - function taking deme list MetaepochSmapshot objects representing previous metaepochs; run every deme run metaepoch determines whether deme remain active. See lsc_max_fitness_evaluations details. sc sprouting condition - function taking 3 arguments: individual, tree level list Deme objects; determines whether given individual can sprout new deme given level. See sc_max_metric details. create_population function taking 6 parameters: mean, lower, upper, population_size, tree_level, sigma returns population Deme object created given tree level. suggestions matrix individuals initial population root with_gradient_method logical determining whether gradient method run leaves end computation refine best solutions. gradient_method_args list parameters passed gradient method run_gradient_method function - returns list named fields: solution, population, value monitor_level string - one 'none', 'basic', 'basic_tree', 'verbose_tree'. parallel logical - TRUE run_metaepoch runs parallel.

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
text: Returns object class hms.

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
code: f <- function(x) x result <- hms(fitness = f, lower = -5, upper = 5) #> A list of standard deviations (sigma) or a function to create population should be provided. #> Metaepoch: 0 Best fitness: 4.853464  #> Metaepoch: 1 Best fitness: 4.982332  #> Metaepoch: 2 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 3 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 4 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 5 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 6 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 7 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 8 Best fitness: 4.995225  #> Metaepoch: 9 Best fitness: 4.995225

what:
Factory function for a trivial local stopping condition that
lets a deme be active forever. It is usually used in the root of
a hms tree. — lsc_trivial
title:

lets a deme be active forever. It is usually used in the root of
a hms tree. — lsc_trivial

what: Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
title: Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
text: Given domain bounds standard deviation returns function compatible GA interface performs mutation given individual using truncated normal distribution.

title: Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
text: lower Lower bound problem's domain upper Upper bound problem's domain sd Standard deviation truncated normal distribution used mutation

title: Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
text: Function takes two parameters (GA object object individual perform mutation parent) returns new individual result normal mutation applied parent.

title: Factory function that creates normal mutation function — rtnorm_mutation
code: mutation <- rtnorm_mutation(   lower = rep(-500, 5),   upper = rep(500, 5),   sd = rep(50, 5) )

title: saveMetaepochsPopulations — saveMetaepochsPopulations,hms-method
text: return anything. creates plots saves specified directory.

title: saveMetaepochsPopulations — saveMetaepochsPopulations,hms-method
code: if (FALSE) { fitness <- function(x) x[1] + x[2] lower <- c(-5, -5) upper <- c(5, 5) result <- hms(fitness = fitness, lower = lower, upper = upper) selected_dimensions <- c(1, 2) saveMetaepochsPopulations(result, paste(getwd(), "/snapshots", sep = ""), selected_dimensions) }

code: f <- function(x) x result <- hms(fitness = f, lower = -5, upper = 5) #> A list of standard deviations (sigma) or a function to create population should be provided. #> Metaepoch: 0 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 1 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 2 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 3 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 4 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 5 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 6 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 7 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 8 Best fitness: 4.995764  #> Metaepoch: 9 Best fitness: 4.995764  show(result) #> An object of class "hms" #>  #> Call: #> hms(fitness = f, lower = -5, upper = 5) #>  #> Available slots: #>  [1] "root_id"                         "metaepoch_snapshots"             #>  [3] "best_fitness"                    "best_solution"                   #>  [5] "total_time_in_seconds"           "total_metaepoch_time_in_seconds" #>  [7] "metaepochs_count"                "deme_population_sizes"           #>  [9] "lower"                           "upper"                           #> [11] "call"

code: f <- function(x) x result <- hms(fitness = f, lower = -5, upper = 5) #> A list of standard deviations (sigma) or a function to create population should be provided. #> Metaepoch: 0 Best fitness: 4.940792  #> Metaepoch: 1 Best fitness: 4.983152  #> Metaepoch: 2 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 3 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 4 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 5 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 6 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 7 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 8 Best fitness: 4.995512  #> Metaepoch: 9 Best fitness: 4.995512  summary(result) #> $fitness #> [1] 4.995512 #>  #> $solution #> [1] "5.00" #>  #> $metaepochs #> [1] 10 #>  #> $deme_population_sizes #> [1] 60 30 15 #>  #> $lower_bound #> [1] "-5.00" #>  #> $upper_bound #> [1] "5.00" #>  #> $computation_time #> [1] "0.175934791564941 seconds" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "summary.hms"
